Humanist Modernism

Design that serves humanity—where modernist clarity meets warmth, readability, and empathy.

Explore the Philosophy View Timeline

What Is Humanist Modernism?

Humanist Modernism emerged as a thoughtful response to the cold precision of early modernist design. While honoring the clarity and rational structure of Swiss Design, it prioritizes human readability, emotional warmth, and cognitive comfort above geometric perfection.

This approach combines the best of two worlds: the systematic thinking and visual order of modernism with the accessible, human-centered principles that make design truly serve its audience. The result is communication that feels both sophisticated and approachable.

"Design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Design is how it works." — Steve Jobs

Visual Characteristics

Typography

  • Open Sans typeface with calligraphic warmth
  • 1.75 line-height for comfortable reading
  • Fluid scales: 16px mobile → 19px desktop
  • OpenType features (ligatures, kerning)
  • 65-75 character optimal line length

Color Palette

  • Cream background (#FAF9F7, not stark white)
  • Warm text (#2D2D2D, softer than black)
  • Approachable blue accent (#3182CE)
  • AAA contrast ratios (15:1 primary text)
  • Organic sage and warm gold accents

Layout & Spacing

  • Generous 96-144px section padding
  • Fluid margins adapt to viewport
  • 1280px max-width for comfortable reading
  • Breathing room between all elements
  • Mobile hyphenation for narrow screens

Reading Experience

  • Text wrapping prevents orphaned words
  • Layered, natural box shadows
  • Soft 6-8px border radius on cards
  • 48px minimum touch targets (WCAG AAA)
  • Semantic HTML for screen readers
